newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks end up, profit taking emerges.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks end up, profit taking emerges.

text.p: Dhaka stocks closed higher in a continued rally and brokers said the uptrend slowed as some of the blue chips fell on profit taking.
The Dhaka Stock Exchange benchmark index rose 0.75 percent or 15.80 points at 2,116.95 on a turnover of 329.9 million taka. Of 111 issues traded, 62 rose, 47 lost and two unchanged.

"Market is stabilising and normalcy is again restored after a volatile week," said one broker. Bangladesh Tobacco lost 16.30 taka to 332.66, Shine Pukur rose 15.75 to 214.86, BD Lamp lost 152.66 to 7,741.23 and Beximco Pharma rose 23 to 255. Friday is weekend in Moslem Bangladesh. -- Dhaka Newsroom 880-2-506363
